general.headline: Partner at Bird & Bird
general.description:
Sophie is a partner of Bird & Bird LLP in the Sydney office. She specialises in media and technology advice and disputes.  She is part of Bird & Bird's global media, entertainment and sport, IT&T and Disputes practices. 

Sophie has substantial IT, telecommunications and media disputes expertise.  She has a depth of experience in acting for major IT and telecommunications companies and large corporate and government customers in disputes including contract and intellectual property disputes.  Her matters have included litigation, a major arbitration, expert determinations, mediations and many negotiations in relation to a variety of software development and licensing, telephony, satellite, and communications technology (including mobile communications technology) issues.  She has acted for high profile media and IT&T companies in 3G telephony patent litigation, and in copyright litigation. 

The communications side of Sophie's practice includes providing advice, policy and dispute resolution assistance in relation to publication laws (such as defamation and contempt), copyright, privacy and surveillance.  She has conducted Privacy Impact Assessments for major smart metering, digital health and transportation projects.  Sophie is also experienced in assisting clients in relation to law reform submissions. 

Sophie has been included in the Best Lawyers list each year since its inception in 2008 and is included in the 2009 Chambers Global Guides and in each Chambers Asia Pacific Guide since 2011.  One client quoted by Chambers describes Sophie as "an excellent, practical litigator with fabulous client skills". She is a co-author of Media and Internet Law and Practice.  In 2012 Sophie was President of the Communication and Media Lawyers Association. 

• Australian National University (Bachelor of Laws - First Class Hons) 
• Australian National University (Bachelor of Economics)

general.headline: Solicitor/Partner at Ashurst, Construction, Energy & Resources Dispute Resolution
general.description:
Georgia Quick is a partner in the litigation and dispute resolution group in Sydney. 

Georgia specialises in dispute resolution and risk management in the areas of energy, construction and major projects and is joint head of the Australian international arbitration practice. 

Prior to working at Ashurst, Georgia worked for the UK's premier construction law firm, for 7 years (returning in 2005) practising primarily in international arbitration for energy clients.  As well as gaining an in-depth knowledge of the conventional power industry, she has gained a unique knowledge of the uranium & nuclear power industry and attended the School of Nuclear Law in France. 

Georgia has been involved in disputes involving numerous jurisdictions including England, Europe (Spain, Italy, the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany and Russia), Nigeria, India, Philippines, and Hong Kong.  She has extensive experience in ICC, LCIA and ad hoc international arbitrations in respect of  FPSOs, power plants, offshore platforms, water treatment plants, material handling facilities, educational and commercial developments, land excavation and reclamation, rolling stock and airport facilities.  Georgia has also been involved in a number of high profile construction and infrastructure matters in the NSW Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and High Court. 

Her work predominantly involves the construction of key contractual provisions such as liquidated damages, extensions of time, performance testing, termination, payment procedures, variations, defects and design responsibility. 

Georgia also regularly advises in respect of dispute resolution clauses and provides strategic advice in relation to cross border dispute resolution and investor - state arbitrations.   

Georgia is known for being balanced, commercially-focused and persuasive.  She values clear communication and effective teamwork in resolving disputes.

'Paul maintains an excellent reputation for his commitment to client service and "understanding of the commercial issues"' (Chambers Global 2016) and is recognised as an 'exceptional structured finance lawyer' (Legal 500 Asia-Pacific 2016).

general.headline: Partner at Ashurst - Employment
general.description:
George Cooper is a partner in our Melbourne office. George specialises in employment, incentives, industrial relations, anti-discrimination and occupational health and safety. 
George has been practising workplace law since 1998. He relocated from Melbourne to Singapore in 2007 to develop and lead an Asian regional employment practice, with a focus on major strategic matters for multi-national employers. He has led Ashurst's Asian employment practice since joining the firm as a partner in 2011.
George returned to Melbourne in 2016 but continues to lead the Asian employment practice, as well practise in domestic matters.
George acts for a number of the firm's major corporate clients in a range of sectors, including banking and finance and energy and resources. George and his team across our Asian offices and network of local counsel contacts provide advice to multi-national companies in all areas of workplace law and strategy. He has particular experience dealing with the employment aspects of cross-border merger and acquisition transactions in Asia and international employment mobility world-wide.
George is ranked as a leading lawyer in Chambers Asia-Pacific 2016 in the category of Singapore: Employment-International (Spotlight Table).

general.headline: Partner at Clayton Utz
general.description:
I work closely with businesses involved in industrial unrest, transformation, disruption, takeovers, mergers, acquisitions, reconstructions, offshoring and outsourcing.

I help my clients manage their workforces in what are often very fluid and potentially volatile situations, so they can develop robust industrial strategies, unlock the value in their core businesses and achieve new growth.

Working with HR business partners, legal counsel, executives, business managers, CEOs/MDs or company boards, my clients appreciate my consistently commercial approach and ability to understand their business strategy, navigate complex legal issues and explain them in an accessible and concise manner.

Although my major focus is on business transformation, industrial relations strategy/enterprise bargaining and discrimination law, I advise on all aspects of industrial relations and employment law, workplace investigations and training, employment aspects of corporate transactions and workplace, health and safety. I also run employment litigation in State and Federal Courts, Commissions and Tribunals.

I have very broad industry experience and work with both private and public sector clients.

general.headline: Specialist in Financial Regulation (inc. Corporate, Banking & Securities), Corporate Governance & ADR/Litigation - Advocate for Gender Equality
general.description:
Lesley Symons is a senior lawyer with more than 20 years experience in the areas of financial services & corporate regulation, commercial, criminal and administrative litigation, dispute resolution, public policy, strategy and risk management. 

Lesley started her legal career as Barrister with the Qld DPP, Judge's Associate, and as a member of the Public Law Advocacy Team at Crown Law. 

She then spent 5 years in London working in legal and management roles with an investment bank (Standard Bank London Limited, part of the Standard International Holdings Group) and in a general in-house commercial role with the Financial Services Compensation Scheme (FSCS). 

On her return to Australia, Lesley joined the commercial litigation group of Clayton Utz. 

During her 7.5 years with ASIC, Lesley performed senior management, legal & strategic policy roles. Lesley was responsible for the management and conduct of some of ASIC's largest and most complex investigations (e.g. Storm Financial), and has extensive experience across the financial services regulation spectrum, from font-end stakeholder engagement, assistance and education, to investigations, enforcement, litigation and policy setting. 

Lesley also provided advice and led projects on behalf of the highest levels of the organisation, including the Commission and Chairman, and represented ASIC on national and international projects, e.g. through IOSCO (the International Organisation of Securities Commissions). 

Lesley now performs dual roles as Special Counsel - Financial Regulation for a boutique law firm, and provides corporate governance advice and services to boards across Australia as a consultant. 

Lesley holds a BA/LLB from the University of Qld, is admitted as a Barrister of the Supreme Court of Qld and the High Court of Australia, is a Solicitor of the Supreme Court of England and Wales and is a recent graduate of the IOSCO/Harvard Law School’s Program on International Financial Systems.

general.description:
'Even the smallest person can change the course of the future' 
- J.R.R. Tolkien

Lisa Leong is a global leader in Client-Centred Innovation and Strategic Account Leadership for Professional Services Firms and In-House Legal Teams. 

Her work and unique approach has been the subject of a Harvard Case Study and a TEDx talk. 

Lisa's purpose is to help people 'find the sunshine'* in work, in relationships and in themselves. 

Lisa is an experienced and engaging Radio Presenter, MC & Facilitator. She is next on-air presenting "Best Practice" on ABC Radio National in mid-October 2018, filling in for five weeks for Richard Aedy, when he goes on a well deserved break. 

Lisa is a graduate of the Customer-Focused Innovation program of Stanford University’s GSB and the Stanford d.school, the Australian Film Television & Radio School, and the University of Melbourne Law School. 

Her superpowers are Curiosity, Creativity and delivering key messages by way of song.

Contact Lisa at lisa@ohtengroup.com

* thanks and acknowledgement to Andrew Thorburn CEO NAB for this lovely phrase "find the sunshine"!

jobs.description:
The OIO Group's mission is to be the world leader in key client growth in B2B organisations. We seek out clients that have an unambiguous ambition to transform their relationships with clients, in order to differentiate themselves from competitors and drive growth in strategic accounts.

What we bring:
1. Focus: the OIO Group focuses exclusively on the design and implementation of priority client growth strategies with B2B organisations.
2. Proven results: we have worked with over 250 key account teams across the legal, Big 4  and banking sectors. To date OIO has helped these teams deliver in excess of GBP600m of incremental revenue
3. Experience with the best: We are a boutique provider working only with the most ambitious firms in any market. 
4. Global best practice: Our work has been the subject of two Harvard case studies. Our approach is based on world renowned research by acknowledged thought leaders and practitioners.

I am next on-air presenting "Best Practice" on ABC Radio National in mid-October 2018, filling in for five weeks for Richard Aedy. 

In Feb and March 2018, I presented the ABC Radio Saturday Afternoon Show (4pm-6pm) across Australia, including "Lisa's Lab" where each week we experimented with a different health and wellbeing approach, technique or "hack" (such as Cryotherapy, Neurofeedback, Kon Marie method, Feng Shui...). 

I also got to speak to some inspirational peeps, including:
- Laura Youngson, Co-Founder Ida Sports & Equal Playing Field: http://www.abc.net.au/radio/programs/saturdayafternoons/laura-youngson/9546706
- Geraldine Coy, creator of "Brave Truth" the board game that inspires authentic conversations in the workplace  http://www.abc.net.au/radio/programs/saturdayafternoons/geraldine-coy/9518002
- Kate Jenkins, Sexual Discrimination Commissioner http://www.abc.net.au/radio/programs/saturdayafternoons/kate-jenkins,-sex-discrimination-commissioner/9464930
- Peggy O'Neal, President Richmond Football Club http://www.abc.net.au/radio/programs/saturdayafternoons/peggy-oneal/9450840

jobs.description:
I focused on client-centred solutions and innovation as part of a global pursuits role. 

My work therefore involved co-designing and implementing innovative solutions with clients to address pressing client needs, creating an exceptional client experience, which includes:
- 'Re-Imagine Legal': an award-winning process, methodology and mindset underpinned by Design Thinking where we partner with clients to ask: How Might We Re-Imagine how Legal is provided to your business?   
- Applying Lean Start Up methodology and elements of the Agile Sprint approach to prototype and test client innovations to implement solutions with impact.

Case Study 1: "Re-Imagine Legal" - We are honoured and excited to have partnered with Telstra Legal to develop an award-winning* innovation collaboration framework, where we stand beside each other and face into the uncertainty and disruption together. By taking this holistic approach, together we have helped to develop a sustainable and growing Innovation movement resulting in significant and quantifiable cost savings and productivity, using Design Thinking, and lean/agile approaches to experimentation and prototyping.  * FT Asia Pacific Innovative Lawyers Award 2016 for "Most Innovative In-House Legal Team" ; and Janders Dean Legal Innovation Index 2016. This work is now the subject of a Harvard Law Case Study. 

Case Study 2: In my role as the Client Relationship Director for a global manufacturing client, we partnered with them through a discovery phase of research (desk and observational), site visits and conversations to gain insight into their stated and unstated needs. We then co-designed various innovative and customised solutions including an innovative and proprietary approach to M&A deals, which we tested and refined. We identified both financial and non financial benefits for both the client and our law firm.

I don't strive for trophies, that's for under achievers. I excel in what I put my mind in and believe in quality and deliverable results over quantity.

The Information Technology Department in Herbert Smith Freehills, manages the technology and financial Application in house, that drives the organisations financial system globally.

I'm responsible with consulting and working closely with our companies key users and stakeholders to identify current operating procedures and to clarify program business objectives.

I'm also responsible for writing documentation to describe custom configuration of financial applications and operating procedures to liaison with 3rd party application development consultants for various integration and ad-hocs and down stream systems.

My experience includes working closely with Management and Senior Partners, and my knowledge covers all aspects of BD, including client relationship management, sector and practice development, strategy, pitching, budgeting, communications, and business planning, driving client loyalty, client experience, revenue and profitability. 

I have established a Business Development Department from scratch, growing it from 1 person to a team of 7.  I have also introduced and implemented a firm wide key client programme and client feedback programme, driving all aspects, including researching the market, identification of clients, allocation and coaching of client relationship partners, meeting with clients, establishing the service delivery experience, collating and communicating feedback, affecting change, implementing back end processes and financial reporting, and training the lawyers. 

I have lead, and worked closely with the Chief Operating Officer and Heads of Department on a number of strategic projects to improve work flow and process within a law firm. These projects include implementing secondments, time recording, matter classification systems, client grouping, service delivery, and managing discounts and special billing instructions from clients.

The most rewarding part of any job for me is the interaction with clients, and service experience / delivery. I have always been fortunate enough to have regular, direct contact with the clients under my care.

general.headline: Founder at The Agile Eleven (We are hiring!) / Enterprise Agile Coach / Organisational Design Consultant / Speaker
general.description:
Driven by my purpose of helping people discover better ways of working I founded The Agile Eleven - a leading business consultancy that uses agile and lean mindsets, practices and tools to improve the way teams and organisations of all sizes and industries work.

The Agile Eleven have been leaders in implementing agile thinking beyond the software arena, working extensively across all business areas, from executive teams to people & culture, sales & marketing to operations, finance & accounting to IT; and with clients across Australia, North America and Asia.

With a career that expands over 20 years across a number of customer centric leadership roles, I feel very privileged to have worked with many large and fast growing digital organisations around the world.

The Agile Eleven now draws and benefits from that experience to help design and implement agile and adaptive organisations that create ongoing value for their customers, while preparing people for the workplace of the future.

jobs.description:
Organisations and teams are constantly under pressure to move faster and deliver more effectively. The Agile Eleven use agile mindsets, practices and tools to help you discover better ways of working; to move quicker and easier; improve communication and collaboration and create a culture of continuous improvement and high employee engagement.
 
The Agile Eleven core expertise is in working with non-software teams (P&C, Marketing, Operations etc.) and we partner in three areas; coaching teams in agile practices, helping business deliver projects in an agile way and working with leaders to build and grow the agile organisation.

The Agile Eleven bring a genuine, creative, human centred and tailored approach to every engagement. Our style is fundamentally practical and hands-on, connected with the real challenges and opportunities in your workplace and designed to deliver immediate, tangible and lasting benefit.

The Agile Contact Centre is a business consultancy created to support brave leaders and organisations to transform their Contact Centre operations to deliver a first class customer and work experience.

We work with contact centre operations teams to transition from a traditional model to an innovative operating model based on the principles of Agile, Lean and Systems thinking.

• Successfully developed a new framework for the Sales Strategy and Support team in Australia based on Sales Enablement, Lead Generation and Sales Support that has changed the perception of the team amongst Sales Managers and Sales Associates and has become the engine for the Sales Organisation.
This framework has helped to improve Sales Results Year on Year by 32% after the first Quarter of FY 12 leaving Australia at 118% to Plan at the end of the Quarter generating $4.6M in opportunities through Sales Enablement Campaigns and Initiatives and $1.3M in Inbound Leads Sales in FY 11

• Develop a framework to support the relationship with more than 200 active resellers and referrers (mainly accountants) of our products increasing the number of sales referrals from the “Accounting Channel” by 10% Year on Year.

• Improved efficiency of the National Sales Team through the development and implementation of a set of Sales Support Tools: a CRM tool (Salesforce.com),  a new Sales Intranet and a framework for the creation, storage and maintenance of the Sales Policies and Procedures.

• Improved Sales Staff retention and efficiency through the development and implementation of Sales Training tools and Programs including Strategic Selling, Coaching programs, Product Training, Sales Skills Training and a new Sales on boarding training program that reduced the time between recruitment to first sale from 60 to 35 days.

• Managed the Victoria Sales Teams (7 BDM’s) for 4 months while we recruited for a new Sales Manager reversing a negative sales results trend in the team.

Primary responsibilities included to lead and manage the National Sales Strategy Team, formed by the Go to Market, Field Marketing and Sales Collateral Teams and to develop, socialise and implement the annual Go to Market Plan consistent of Channel Structure, Targets, Goals and Commission Structure for a sales force of 115 account managers and business development managers.

Key Achievements:

• Created, delivered and successfully rolled out the Go to Market and Sales Strategy Plans for Sensis Classifieds for Financial Years 2008, 2009 and 2010 including Channel Structure, Targets, Client Allocation and Commission Structure and contributed to the achievement of revenue targets for those financial years in excess of AU$80M per year. Improved Channel Cooperation and develop and implement innovative strategic sales plans, new product launches and below the line campaigns at a State and national level to achieve 10% growth year on year in Online Sales and maintain forecasted print sales declines.

• Coach, manage and support 9 staff (3 in Melbourne, 3 in Brisbane, 2 in Sydney and 1 in Adelaide), coordinating activities, recruitment, development plans and training sessions consistent with the organisation’s values.

• Lead the development of the annual sales business plan for each sales channel including initiative identification, quantification, & reporting.

• Represented National Sales on a range of projects including delivery of the new Trading Post website (with auctions functionality) and delivery and implementation of a new Ad Placing and reporting system for 1500 Automotive Dealers nationally.

• Improved Sales efficiency through the development and implementation of Sales Tools and Field Marketing Campaigns

• Coordinate marketing materials, sales collateral and sales presentations and proposals to support national campaigns and initiatives.

Primary responsibilities included to lead and manage the Customer and Partners Service Area; developing innovative strategies to enhance service delivery for job seekers who visit the LinkMe website.

jobs.description:
Guardian proudly own and operate over 100 Child Care and Early Learning Centres around Australia. Every day thousands of families entrust us with the care and education of their children.

Our vision is to become the highest quality provider of child care centres in Australia, nurturing young children in their early years to fulfil their potential through formal schooling, lifelong learning, into wider life and employment.

We believe children need to be prepared with a set of skills and aptitudes so they can become active participants in an increasingly complex, globally-connected and changing world. Our early education approach is designed to build confidence and initiative, helping children to develop successful social relationships, resolve conflicts and become emotionally resilient.

Our name, Guardian, reflects our vision in that we are custodians of tomorrow’s world through the children of today.

Working alongside the GM for the Northern Region and 7 Operations Managers, I support the Centres across the states in a true generalist capacity. It is a multi-site role, with time spent with the Operations Team in the field to coach and deliver key people and change initiatives.

Millennial People is a privately owned and operated Executive Recruitment consultancy. We specialise in Executive Recruitment in Technology, Digital, Analytics & Consulting. 

Our vision is to redefine Recruitment and that starts with being able to understand the local market, challenging ourselves to learn more, question more and therefore find the best talent solution for our clients. 

We aim to deliver exceptional service and representation to our customers. Our specialised approach enables broader, deeper and faster access to in-demand and specialist candidates.

Your success is ours, we want our customers realising business advantage through talent. Our approach allows us to adapt to suit the changing demands of the markets we service and the sectors our customers compete in.

We provide subject matter expertise across Technology, Transformation and Change, Insights & Data Analytics.

Leading the HR Team at Pacific Magazines, I am responsible for setting the people and development agenda for the business. The Pacific business is transforming, my role has been greatly focused on embedding the basic People Frameworks required by any large organisation and also developing the Development Framework to ensure we are continually growing our People.

Since joining Pacific, I have launched and landed the following People Initiatives:
-	Pacific’s People Survey – delivered our very first Pacific People Survey
-	Launched New People & Development Program – No performance reviews conducted in 5 years
-	Reviewed & Refined key people policies and policy improvement aligning to people strategy

-	Simplification of Recruitment as a Process and working on implementation of new HRIS

        conflict in the workplace
-	Successfully and continually build the HR Team brand and re-establish the role of the HR Team for 
        Pacific

The stores across these two are large volume trading stores with different complexities and manager capabiltities.

Zip Co Limited (ASX: ZML) is an ASX-listed provider of innovative payment and credit solutions to retailers (online and in-store) across the digital checkout. We employ the latest tools in fraud prevention, risk management and social scoring to deliver real-time decisions to savvy digital shoppers. 

Zip is FOR Australian business. We help retailers convert browsers into paid customers (+20%), increase basket sizes (+50%) and encourage repeat shopping behaviour (+50%). There are now over 1 million users of our core products.

Zip has three core products: 

(1) zipPay - Digital wallet (up to $1,000) that helps customers buy now and pay later for everyday purchases online and in-store (fashion, hospitality, CE/IT products) with no interest ever. See www.zippay.com.au

(2) zipMoney - Digital wallet (up to $30,000) that helps customers buy now and pay later for life’s larger purchases online and in-store (CE/IT, travel, lifestyle) with healthy interest-free periods. See www.zipmoney.com.au

(3) Pocketbook - The free Pocketbook mobile app helps you get smart with your money. It automatically categorises your spending (eg clothes, groceries) to help you reach your financial goals.
See www.getpocketbook.com

We currently operate in the retail, education, health and travel markets across the omni-channel

Zip is funded by $400m in institutional funding from a range of parties including NAB to support its payment operations. We have a strong focus on responsible financial services - Zip holds both an Australian Financial Services Licence and an Australian Credit Licence.

We are passionate about Education and Technology, because ultimately, we believe that learning changes lives!

general.headline:
Founder & CEO mwah. Making Work Absolutely Human |
Telstra Business Woman & HR Leader of Year | Determined Optimist
general.description:
HR Aficionado – I love the people stuff! 
I’ve made it my life’s work – Leadership, Culture, Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, Talent, Trust and Relationships. 
From some of the biggest companies in the world, to some of the smallest, newest and most creative entrepreneurs, to some awesome not-for-profits that are changing the world. 
All the time, learning and changing the way we work together and focused obsessively on the way we might work together. 

To that end, I’ve co-founded a business called mwah. Making Work Absolutely Human. 
It is a knowledge base and a community of all the real stuff you need to lead and work with people, today and in the future. 
It’s based on this simple philosophy. 

The mwah. philosophy:
Work is a fundamental human right.
The right to contribute.
The opportunity to use our hands, our minds, our strength, our creativity & sometimes even our hearts, to contribute to the community in which we live. 
Whether the community be family, local, organisational, national, or global, our contribution gives us a sense of purpose, of belonging, of being useful.
The opportunity to grow & develop, to learn & meet new perspectives, even to teach others, makes each of us a little more than we were yesterday.
The accountability & responsibility to others – to encourage, to coach, to inspire, to lead, to follow, to impact, to care, or sometimes just to show up & share the load – provides a deep connectivity. We can rely on others & they can rely on us.
The more of us contributing our best, makes for a better team, a better organisation, a better country, a better economy, a better society & ultimately a better world.

Copyright

general.headline: Founder & Editor in Chief at Collective Hub
general.description:
Lisa Messenger is the vibrant, game-changing CEO of The Messenger Group, as well as founder and editor-in-chief of Collective Hub – a multi-platform entrepreneurial lifestyle destination with a mandate to disrupt, challenge and inspire. In addition, she has worked globally in events, sponsorship, marketing, PR and publishing. 

Lisa launched The Messenger Group in 2001, which has since custom published more than 400 books for companies and individuals. Lisa has authored and co-authored 16 books and become an authority in the start-up scene.  

Most notably, Lisa charted her rollercoaster ride to success in best-selling book Daring & Disruptive and its sequel Life & Love, which reached #1 on Booktopia.  Lisa’s next book, Money and Mindfulness was released late in 2015 and also hit best-selling status within the first month. In 2016 Lisa released Break-ups and Breakthroughs, thus adding to her collection of writing achievements. Lisa is also a regular contributor to the Huffington Post and has her own section on Telstra’s Smarter Business Ideas online.

Lisa has been a regular commentator on business, entrepreneurialism and property and has sat on a number of boards including the Australian Businesswomen’s Network and Publishers Australia.

Her passion is to challenge individuals and corporations to change the way they think, take them out of their comfort zone and prove that there is more than one way to do anything. She encourages entrepreneurial spirit, creativity and innovation and lives life to the absolute max. With fans including Sir Richard Branson, New York Times Best-selling author Bradley Trevor Grieve, and a social media following of well over 100,000, Lisa’s vision is to build a community of likeminded people who want to change the world.

jobs.description:
Lisa launched Collective Hub in 2013 as a print magazine in 37 countries, but it quickly became a global sensation.

Today, it has evolved into a true multimedia brand that encompasses engaging digital content, bespoke events, strategic collaborations and unique product extensions.

Across it all, Collective Hub‘s vision is to uplift and empower people to live their lives to the fullest.

Combining style and substance with a fresh perspective on the issues that matter most, Collective Hub covers business, design, technology, social change, fashion, travel, food, film and art.

Messenger Publishing is a creative and innovative consultancy that thrives on lateral thinking to create out of the box solutions for our clients.  We are never limited by conventions and traditional approaches and love to push comfort zones and invoke attitudinal shift to make extraordinary things happen.  
Our mission is to make the dreams and goals of our clients come alive. We are passionate about having fun and letting our imaginations soar beyond predictable solutions, demonstrating that there is always more than one way to do anything.  

Our unique publishing model is based on funding and distribution partners and is a result of our years not in the publishing industry but in the world of marketing, sponsorship and strategic alliances.  This model enables corporates and individuals to produce books that can become a credible, lasting extension of your brand, an integral part of your existing marketing mix and an additional source of revenue.

Unique, innovative strategic marketing solutions that will take you beyond your
      comfort zone and change the way you think! Specialities around events, sponsorship,
      
      PR, publishing, strategic alliances and anything off the wall.

Here at The Messenger Group, we focus on content creation and strategic engagement by syncing our custom publishing model with our thirst for social media strategies.

Ironically our name says it all (coincidentally our founder and creative director shares the same surname). What we do is actually quite simple.

We translate messages – strategically and creatively.
Our unique non-traditional funding and distribution models have allowed us to dominate the corporate sales market and flip the publishing industry on its head.

While our core focus is producing books and magazines as an extension of brand and as a marketing tool, we also specialise in content creation, branding, design and marketing solutions.

We strongly believe that no good idea should be abandoned and that there’s never only one way to do something.

general.headline:
SheStarts Director,
Head of Diversity & Impact
BlueChilli
general.description:
I'm a communicator, a collaborator, a social change maker.
With a career spanning a range of industries, starting in the media, government and NGO sectors, and now in tech and innovation, I've developed my skills and leadership as an expert in communication and innovation for social change.

As SheStarts Director and Head of Diversity and Impact at BlueChilli, I lead the company's efforts to improve gender equality, inclusivity and social impact in the startup and innovation economy, leveraging my capabilities in designing and delivering cross-sector collaborations and partnerships, bringing together corporates, startups, government and community organisations to affect change.

My flagship program is SheStarts, Australia's only corporate and venture-backed accelerator specifically designed for female founders. Launched in 2016, the SheStarts program has now invested in two cohorts of female-led startups, received international acclaim as an exemplar of inclusive entrepreneurship and released an award-winning documentary series to redefine what it means to be a tech entrepreneur. The latest series is available here on LinkedIn: http://lnkd.in/shestarts

I'm a passionate contributor to the global dialogue on gender equality and social innovation, as an active member of the OECD Expert Advisory Committee on Digital Transformation; a non-executive director of Australian advocacy organisation The Parenthood; and a mentor and judge for national awards programs including the Telstra Business Women's Awards, the Walkley Awards for Media Innovation, Women’s Agenda Leadership Awards and FYA's Young Social Pioneers.

A regular on the international speakers circuit, I have been invited to speak at the APEC Women Business Leaders’ Summit in Seoul, the OECD Forum on Inclusive Growth in Paris, Australia’s inaugural Myriad Festival, Tech Inclusion, Pause Fest, Wild Digital and Vogue Codes, sharing the stories of women in tech leadership with audiences around the world.

jobs.jobTitle: SheStarts Director, Head of Diversity & Impact
jobs.description:
BlueChilli is Australia's leading startup and innovation group - working with entrepreneurs, corporates and investors to tackle the world's biggest challenges and tap into disruptive market opportunities.
Our flagship diversity program is SheStarts, Australia's only corporate and venture-backed tech accelerator program specifically designed for female founders.
Since it's launch in 2016, the SheStarts Accelerator has received international acclaim as an exemplar of best practice for inclusive entrepreneurship and was named Australian Accelerator of the Year in 2017. The program has invested in two cohorts of female entrepreneurs from all over Australia, helping the founders to take their ideas and turn them into globally scalable, high-impact tech companies. The award-winning SheStarts Documentary series follows the founders on their startup journey. The debut season of the series took out Silver at the prestigious Mumbrella BEFEST Awards, after it reached more than half a million views - showing women you don’t have to be a dude in a hoodie and sneakers to be a tech entrepreneur.

general.description:
Tim is a Human Resources professional who specialises in initiatives that drive business efficiencies, improvements and integrate sales, marketing and people. Tim is capable in leading end to end projects in business growth and optimisation; from strategic planning to implementation and review. He is a proven transformational leader and has successfully married employee value propositions with company brand and values to increase retention, engagement and profit results.

Tim is uniquely positioned with a thorough knowledge of the challenges experienced by training organisations and also industry's workforce planning needs. Having lead HR functions and teams in the hospitality and education sector and taught at VET and HE levels he understands the nexus between education and employment.

His commercial acumen and educational experience position him uniquely in the educational management arena.

Complex Institute of Education (CIE) a leading Registered Training Organisation specialising in the training, and launching!, of students in the Security, Risk Management & Public Safety arena. With a wider repertoire of Hospitality, Cleaning, Training and Assessment and Vocational Preparation courses on scope, CIE is fast becoming the market leader for launching students from education into employment.

Operating since the year 2000, we are considered as one of Australia’s leading providers of quality training that leads to employment for our graduates. We pride ourselves on delivering quality accredited and non-accredited training to the general public, the unemployed and to discerning corporate clients.

SELMAR Institute of Education (SELMAR) is an award winning Registered Training Organisation with a national footprint. With an increasing presence in the Children's Services sector, SELMAR have a presence with over 40% of the Melbourne Metro market. Their presence in the Aged Care sector continues to grow. They are highly regarded in the Training & Assessment arena and were very proud of their relationship with the Australian Human Resources Institute. 

Human Resources Key Achievements:

As the Government endorsed Specialist Centre for Hospitality, Tourism and Culinary Arts, William Angliss Institute works with industry leaders to develop innovative training solutions that meet the needs of today's industry, including membership and affiliation with a range of Australian and international industry and educational organisations.

In this role I liaised with over 800 industry employers across Victoria, and was awarded the 2011 Clients Services Award (Employee of the Year) – March 2011.

Key achievements:

• Realignment of separate business processes across functional silos
• Restructuring of separate resources into common, central Placement Program

Cornerstone Hotels, established in May 2007, quickly acquired and consolidated 21 individual hospitality businesses in Victoria. Operating a suite of diversified businesses, including The Botanical in South Yarra, Richmond Public House and funky bars like the Lucky Coq and Bimbo Deluxe, the group operated bistros, pubs, and gaming venues as a consolidated company.

The Group HR Manager role worked across individual SMEs to successfully consolidate employment instruments, OH&S procedures and L&D framework. Over capitalisation lead to the company being placed into administration in 2009.

Key achievements:

• Establish HR Function – new role, Greenfield establishment
• Write policies and procedures, and deliver performance management program
• Establish Injury Management framework and process
• Assess compliance risk – including Food Safety Program roll out

Peter Rowland Catering was established in 1962. During the company’s years of success, Peter’s creativity and unique sense of occasion have expanded popular conceptions of what catering can and should be. In this role I was responsible for over 2300 casual Award employees, deployed across 3 businesses, including Rowland Major Events, Peter Rowland Catering and Rowland Commercial Catering.

Epicure Catering, is an indulgence brand. They provide fine food experiences for discerning intimate groups or gala events. For high profile events like the Australian Formula One Grand Prix, it takes months of planning to satisfy 30 000 VIP corporate guests in only four days. At the AFL matches played weekly at Melbourne’s MCG, on average we host about 3,700 VIP guests across 131 corporate suites and 21 dining rooms. 

Key Achievements:

• Yield management process implemented to reduce the cost of agency staff

general.headline: Head of People Operations at Merivale
general.description:
Meet Ashlee, who am I? I am a Sydney local who has travelled over 5 continents as a professional Trip Advisor, a BIG food & wine lover, often described as a perfectionist with a side of creative flair spending much of my free time involved in graphic design, cake decorating and making clothes. I studied fashion design yet fell into Human Resources 8 years ago, I love it and have never looked back.

In a professional space, my career aim is to ‘Make a difference’, this is what I get out of bed for. Within my HR specialities tool belt are all the normal things you would expect of a seasoned HR professional. I take charge of my career and development, I focus, can take direction, I follow through and act. I spot relevant patterns and issues and problem solve. My team describe me as  having ‘high standards’ and ‘decisive’, I am not afraid to make a decision and pass on my opinion. 

I like to be known as knowledgeable, balanced and having high integrity. 

I am most passionate about being a true partner with the business, being involved and dedicated to the operational aspect of business whilst being hands on, not hiding behind a desk. My other passions lie in the training space, delivering on a training strategy, developing sessions and rolling out sessions and plans. 

I am most proud of my team who I have acquired over the last two years, developing them to take on new roles, challenging them to improve themselves and the business and watching them take what is expected of HR to the next level. 

My next challenge will see me completing my next multi-day hike at altitude, after just recovering from the Inca Trail, suggestions welcome!

jobs.companyName: The Women's College, within The University of Sydney
jobs.description: Women's College has been developing women leaders since 1892. The College acts as an incubator for women as they study at the University of Sydney, providing tuition support, leadership development and life long networks.  Currently, the College is undertaking a major building project to develop a centre for women's leadership - the Sybil Centre.  For more information, visit https://www.thewomenscollege.com.au/

The PwC Diversity and Inclusion Strategy is based on four pillars for change - Stepping up as leaders; Creating accountability; Disrupting the status quo; Dismantling barriers for careers. It is designed to: Build credibitly with staff; Show the marketplace PwC are a 'match fit'; Shift partners' and leaders' mindset and behaviours; and Coordinate and enable business relevant change. Delivering on the Diversity and Inclusion Strategy will also improve PwC's results on the newly introduced Global Inclusion Index.  The Diversity Advisory Board supports the CEO, Luke Sayers, to design, review and implement the D&I Strategy

jobs.companyName: Australian National Committee for UN Women
jobs.description:
UN Women is the new United Nations entity for gender equality and the empowerment of women. Formed by the General Assembly in January, the agency replaces UNIFEM.  UN Women works across the world to promote women's human rights, economic security and political participation.  In Australia, the National Committee works to challenge attitudes which perpetuate inequality, engage government and raise much needed funds.

This year is a critical year for gender equality.  The United Nations are negotiating the new Sustainable Development Goals, and discussing the model for financing development.  Gender equality underpins both these processes so we are working hard to ensure that the rights of women and girls are front and centre!

We are also working to ensure that the private sector, government and civil society are workign together to advance gender equality.  To do this, we are focusing on promoting the Women's Empowerment Principles.  We are proud to have launched the #HeforShe Campaign in Australia and are encouraging men to take active steps to be advocates for gender equality. We continue to work with the Australian Government to ensure that funding to UN Women through the Australian Aid program continues to support UN Women's work in our region.

YWCA Canberra is a feminist, not-for-profit organisation that has been providing community services and representing women’s issues in Canberra since its establishment in 1929. Today, the YWCA is respected for it's women's leadership training, support to families and children and as a major provider of child care in the ACT.  As a Board Member and Vice-President, I was involved in all aspects of the strategic planning and governance.

The United Nations Association of Australia is an NGO working to promote Australia's engagement with the UN and raise awareness in the general public about the importance of the UN.

Currently, we are working to develop UN Associations in the Pacific, to increase the level of engagement with the UN.  Our first Association in PNG has just been accredited!

During my time with UNIFEM Australia, I was seconded to the White Ribbon Campaign.  The White Ribbon Foundation (a sister organisation to UNIFEM Australia) is part of  a global campaign to engage men in ending violence against women.  The campaign is led by men from all sectors including, politics, media, sports, government and corporates, who are passionate about ending violence against women.

The campaign asks men not to commit, condone or remain silent about violence against women.  It seeks to challenge the attitudes which perpetuate violence and works with young men and boys to ensure that our future leaders will work actively on this issue.

general.headline: Sales & Category Recruitment Specialist | FMCG & Consumer Goods |
general.description:
Enthusiastic, social and highly driven, I’m an executive recruiter specialising in sales and marketing recruitment for the FMCG and Retail sector.

With experience in Health & Beauty, Lifestyle, Beverages, Food and Non-food, I have a deep understanding of the FMCG and retail markets, offering valuable insights to my clients and candidates. 

I’m passionate about networking and I love to meet new people. I believe the success I’ve had in recruitment is born out of my ability to get to know my clients and candidates on a more personal level, giving them a very high quality of service. I’ve won awards for my excellent service levels. What really inspires me to do the best job possible is those close relationships; when I get to offer a candidate their dream job I’m genuinely excited for them! It’s a celebration for all the parties involved! 

I enjoy partnering with clients who share my enthusiasm for workplace culture, innovative “out-of-the-box” thinking and genuine interest for their industries. I believe the best partnerships are built on trust and respect.

A degree qualified HR Professional, Bevan has developed highly successful in-house recruitment teams over the past 20 years having gained experience globally in Africa, UK; US and the Asia Pacific region. With demonstrated authentic and credible leadership, Bevan provides result driven outcomes for the business. 

Currently the Head of Talent Acquisition at Rio Tinto, ensuring the long term talent strategy is aligned with delivery of recruitment services globally. Prior to this he held various roles at Jacobs including Director, Talent Acquisition for the APAC region and a two year assignment as Head of the TA Centre of Excellence in the Corporate head office in the US, where Bevan was instrumental in the global implementation of Taleo as well as associated roll out of global TA processes and guidelines to provide a more collaborative global team environment. 

Strengths are strongly focused in building, implementing and maintaining internal recruitment & resourcing models and acting as a true business partner in order to best deliver the talent required for driving business strategy.

Bevan holds an Honours degree (University of Natal, South Africa) majoring in Psychology and a post graduate HR qualification from Deakin University.

general.description:
As the Senior Vice President and General Manager of Jacobs’ Buildings & Infrastructure Asia Pacific & Middle East business, I lead over 6,000 employees in the delivery of critical buildings, power, transport, water and environmental projects that shape our cities and communities. 
My career in professional services began over 20 years ago as a water process engineer. Since then I have undertaken several leadership positions within Jacobs across various sectors (water, power, telecommunications and infrastructure) and operations (Asia, Australia, New Zealand, Middle East, United States, Europe and South America). 
I am fortunate to have been exposed to multiple geographies, markets and disciplines during my career and it is a privilege to work with some of the top talent in our industry. It is the people who are the cornerstone of our professional services industry and as such, my focus combines people leadership and delivering technical excellence to our clients. It is important that the work we deliver to clients is reflective of a diverse, innovative and inclusive culture internally. 
Jacobs is one of the world’s largest and most diverse providers of technical, professional, and construction services, including all aspects of architecture, engineering and construction, operations and maintenance, as well as scientific and specialty consulting. We serve a broad range of companies and organizations, including industrial, commercial, and government clients across multiple markets and geographies.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer
general.description:
Experienced c-suite level executive with 20+ years experience in media and technology businesses including Better Caring, News Corp Australia and mi9. Cross-functional experience has given me unique insight and expertise into consumer audiences, market disruption, developing customer-centric products, the importance of fluid, agile strategy and the ability to adapt and execute quickly. 
 
My leadership style is collaborative. I believe in creating an organisational culture that drives innovative and strategic thinking, collaboration and trust. My passion is a commitment to improve the lives of Australians using technology to enhance, enable and connect communities. 

By far my most challenging and rewarding role to date is being a mother to two children. Being a parent reignited my passion for creativity, taught me the art of patience and listening and fuels my passion to live each day with purpose.

jobs.description: Mable (Formerly Better Caring) is a start up and fast growing business in the health tech sector. The platform is a two sided marketplace in the aged and disability sector connecting consumers with  independent support workers.  As CEO I was brought into the business to develop the strategic direction for the company, creating a new operating rhythm and focus and building a high performing, data driven team and culture. A critical strategic focus was developing the new brand positioning for Better Caring, creating a more relevant and modern brand being Mable which included developing strategic brand values and positioning and omni channel creative execution.

jobs.jobTitle: General Manager - News Local NSW Community Division
jobs.description: News Local is News Corporation Australia’s community newspaper division in NSW. As General Manager I had P&L responsibility for 20  local newspaper and digital brands including The Manly Daily, The Wentworth Courier, The Inner West Courier, The North Shore Times, Hills Shire Times, Hornsby Advocate and Parramatta Advertiser. The News Local brands are strong advocates for the communities they serve and help champion local issues and local heroes. I helped drive our innovation and change agenda across our content strategy, operations, marketing, distribution and sales divisions.  Highlights included launching the INMA award winning bespoke custom luxury magazine and digital brand Summer and Seasons targeting an affluent inner city audience.

general.headline: Chief Operating Officer, Publishing at News Corp Australia
general.description: An experienced executive that has worked across retail, financial services and media industries in a broad array of roles. Most notably having acted in a CMO capacity for one of Australia's leading retailers, one of Australia's leading banks, and Australia's leading media organisation. Now serving as Chief Operating Officer of News Corp Australia's publishing division.

jobs.description:
Accountable for metropolitan, regional and community publishing divisions. Also accountable for group production, logistics, marketing and advertising sales.


Metropolitan, Regional and Community print and digital publishing brands include:

NSW: [metro] The Daily Telegraph, The Sunday Telegraph; [regional] The Northern Star (Lismore/Northern Rivers), The Daily Examiner (Grafton/Clarence Valley); [community] The News Local group of 20 suburban publications across Sydney.

VIC: [metro] The Herald Sun, The Sunday Herald Sun; [regional] The Geelong Advertiser; [rural] The Weekly Times; [community] The Leader group of 26 suburban publications across Melbourne.

QLD: [metro] The Courier Mail, The Sunday Mail; [regional] The Gold Coast Bulletin, The Cairns Post, The Townsville Bulletin, Daily Mercury (Mackay/Whitsundays), The Morning Bulletin (Rockhampton), The Observer (Gladstone), NewsMail (Bundaberg), Fraser Coast Chronicle, The Gympie Times, Warwick Daily News, The Chronicle (Toowoomba), Sunshine Coast Daily, QT - The Queensland Times; [rural] Rural Weekly; [speciality] Seniors; [community] The Quest group of 15 suburban publications across Brisbane.

SA: [metro] The Advertiser, Sunday Mail; [communities] The Messenger group of 10 suburban publications across Adelaide.

TAS: [regional] The Mercury, The Sunday Tasmanian; [rural] Tasmanian Country

NT: [regional] NT News, The Sunday Territorian; [rural] Rural Weekly

Board member of NewsMediaWorks since June 2015. NMW advocates across a spectrum of commercial and editorial areas on behalf of the news publishing industry. Promotion of the compelling value of our audiences in print and digital, and the protection of press freedom, are priority activities. We do this on behalf of all Australian mainstream news publishers including News Corp Australia, Fairfax Media and West Australian Newspapers.

Board member of The Readership Works since March 2013. The Readership Works was established to oversee the creation and ongoing provision of a new global best practice readership metric in Australia. Enhanced Media Metrics Australia (emma) was launched in 2013 and provides marketers with the most sophisticated cross-platform audience readership and engagement data available.

The International News Media Association (INMA) is the world’s leading provider of
      global best practices for news media companies looking to grow revenue, audience,
      
      and brand amid profound market change.

Carsguide.com.au is a joint venture between News Corp Australia and a network of some of Australia’s largest automotive dealer groups. With thousands of cars for sale, and a comprehensive range of automotive news, new and used car reviews, photos and videos, tools and advice, Carsguide.com.au is an invaluable resource for anyone looking to buy their next car; those who want to sell their car, for the avid motoring enthusiast or casual car buff.

The Association for Data-driven Marketing & Advertising - or ADMA - is the largest marketing body in Australia. Members are among the leading advertisers, marketers, agencies, fulfilment, telemarketing and production companies. ADMA supports Members with advocacy to Government and regulators, education, events and awards, codes of practice to help them comply as well as a rich source of online and offline resources.

Accountable for the marketing of News Corp Australia's publishing brands across both
      
      print and digital platforms.

Responsible for two key strategic partnerships within News Corp Australia. Following the full acquisition of Fox Sports by News Corp Australia in 2014, was responsible for the development of a new integrated sales capability within News Corp Australia to sell integrated cross platform sports media. Also, represented News Corp Australia on the Board of The Readership Works - the industry body representing the major Australian news media organisations. Accountable for the successful launch of a new cross-platform media consumption methodology called 'emma' - Enhanced Media Metrics Australia.

general.headline: Executive General Manager Community & Consumer at Australia Post
general.description:
Nicole is a highly accomplished senior executive with extensive experience in the media, marketing and digital industries. 

As Executive General Manager for Community & Consumer at Australia Post, Nicole is accountable for delivering seamless experiences across the key customer channels including Australia’s largest retail network, with over 4,300 post offices, the customer contact centre and digital channels. She is also responsible for brand, marketing, community and corporate social responsibility. 
 
Prior to joining Australia Post in August 2018, Nicole held a number of influential leadership roles in print, broadcast and digital media. Most recently, she was the Chief Digital Officer for News Corp Australia, responsible for the company's digital revenue growth and strategy, audience and subscription growth, content optimisation and marketing. She was instrumental in driving transformation across its digital products and technology platforms in light of changing customer needs.
 
Before that she was the Chief Executive of NewsLifeMedia, leading the lifestyle publishing division, known for well-loved brands such news.com.au, Taste.com.au, Vogue, Donna Hay and Country Style. Her career also spans roles in broadcast media, publishing and telecommunications.
 
Nicole is a regular speaker and commentator on business, media and women’s issues, is a Director of Chief Executive Women (CEW) and held the role of Chair of the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) Australia Board.
 
She holds a Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Laws from Macquarie University and a Masters of Business from the University of Technology Sydney.

general.headline: Chief Digital Officer
general.description:
David is a globally credentialed technology executive, specialising in data-driven digital transformation across corporations of various sizes and locations. Successfully developing and implementing large scale company wide change, David's recent projects include the technical coordination and build of large scale data assets, importantly including it's protection through security, governance, and data regulatory compliance. 

Complementary to this approach is also the ability to successfully craft an operational structure for "all of business", including educational change at a departmental level endorsed through Executive / Board buy-in. 

David's career background also includes digital product monetization, customer / audience growth, plus extensive digital marketing (programmatic) utilising data intelligence. David has successfully built teams from scratch as well as taken on established corporate units, leading both content, development & sales across APAC (including Japan), UK and the US. 

Other elements include being a member of various Boards, Advisory Boards, and Investor relationships across technology and Not-For-Profit organisations, as well as being a sought after speaker at industry conferences.

jobs.description:

The CA Digital Services Team is chartered with providing technology-led products and services for the wider industry and includes application development, commercial partnerships, analytics, thought-leadership, education (both Board, C-SUite and Operational staff), as well as asset creation (including Centralised Data) and investment guidance.

Ternio is a cryptocurrency built to dramatically improve the programmatic revenue exchange between media organizations and advertisers. The Ternio blockchain streamlines the process from the start of the supply chain with secure transparent logs, no-cost fraud verification, and instant publisher payments - decentrally managing the buying and selling of ad inventory.

Global voice-based social media platform transforming the way people engage with their social media network. Utilizing the power of audio, users upload and listen to, up to 42-seconds of posts through the HearMeOut app - as well as through the platform’s native feed across other social networks, such as Twitter or Facebook.

general.headline: General Manager at BMYG Wealth
general.school: The University of Sydney Business School
general.description:
Jeffrey Liu is a passionate wealth management thought leader, educator and motivator, believing in his 3E principle in life: 
1.Entertain: To create a comfortable and joyful environment around people. 
2.Educate: To share the professional knowledge and experience with the needy. 
3. Empower: To encourage and motivate the needy  to take action and start changing their life for the better and more abundant life. 
Jeffrey love Music and believes the right attitude is the beginning of a great journey. Being faithful and focused in small things in life will lead to greater things in life. 
In 2010, Jeffrey became the 1st Chinese overseas student who has performed on the Australia’s Got Talent Semi-final stage in history.
In 2016, he was recognised by the largest TV network in China -"CCTV international channel" for the contribution as a culture bridge between Australia and China via Music and Financial service.
Due to his passion and hobby in music, Jeffrey founded "Hippo Music" which believes in the power of music to connect people and help one find the rhythm of life and reach one’s full potential. This is manifested through “HippoShow”, “HippoTeach” and “HippoTalk”.
刘梦麒, BMYG Wealth博满财富总经理兼高级理财顾问, 澳洲首档财富管理原创节目“理财麒谈”撰稿人兼主持人，拥有悉尼大学商科学士学位和高级财务规划师证书。在金融行业从业近10年，曾任职于澳洲四大银行中的Westpac西太银行及ANZ澳新银行，拥有丰富的财富管理行业经验。专业领域包括：养老金规划，投资策略，财富保护，财富传承计划等。2017年曾两次被澳洲国家电台SBS特约分享理财心得。

他曾任Westpac总部的双语理财师，负责全澳范围的个人财富管理业务及Westpac贵宾部和私人银行的部分高净值客户的财富管理。此外，还曾任职Westpac的合规理财培训师，负责全国超过300名理财师的理财建议审核工作，并提供相关培训。

general.headline: Personalised leadership development and coaching
general.description:
Leadership is a slippery concept! I believe it is more about disposition than position, and that it is never too early or too late to learn and develop. 

Very few leaders are trained in leading – they are promoted to higher levels of responsibility because they are good at what they do. Positive leadership growth involves building 'personal practical knowledge' – embodied, intuitive knowledge accumulated over time through rich, reflective experience. We focus on approaches that build trust and commitment to a shared vision. The energy, influence and alignment which this generates can lead to extraordinary improvement, especially when personal behaviour is scrupulously in accord with core values. 

As our contexts grow more volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous, many conventional approaches to leadership challenges disappoint. Rather than our lives being a series of unfolding, empirical events, it can be more helpful to see them as a series of stories we construct to make sense of our experiences. I believe wise leaders are rich in narrative intelligence – shaping and reading the nuanced narratives of their contexts and generating positive action to move agendas forward.

I am a ‘Growth Coaching International’ Accredited Executive Coach, and incorporate strengths-based, solutions-focused coaching approaches in my work. Please let me support you to visualise who you seek to be as a leader, and to reach for what is highest in you as you take your leadership to the next level.

jobs.description:
At Allora Leadership and Coaching we will support you to strengthen your capacity to:
•	Inspire and motivate others
•	Create time and space to be more proactive and less reactive
•	Generate high levels of trust and influence 
•	Lead a performance culture grounded in respect and excellence
•	Have clear priorities and goals; and an overarching purpose and vision
•	Think clearly and decisively
•	Communicate effectively, respectfully and professionally, especially in challenging situations
•	Build collaboration, shared responsibility and individual accountability
•	See what really counts in your ‘work’
•	Develop authentic feedback processes
•	Be innovative
•	Lead with grit and resilience
•	Develop a growth and inquiry mindset
•	Apply evidence-informed inquiry and decision-making
•	Design and evaluate systems and processes aligned with your organisation’s goals
•	Develop your emotional intelligence

Parental engagement in their child's education is the missing link according to research.  
Are you looking to take the drama out of parent teacher relationships and get them working on the same page for the benefit of the the child's learning and their wellbeing?  

For all Children to live successfully is an important goal for any society to achieve.  It requires a focus on student learning and achievement and ultimately their well-being.  For families it is a lifetime process. Schools play an important role in the education of the children of a society and increasingly are taking on the responsibility of all aspects of the child’s development not just academic.  It is in the best interests of the child to have all parties working together in authentic partnership to foster student achievement and wellbeing.  The purpose of this professional development program is to build the capacity for all to work together for wellbeing for students.

jobs.jobTitle: To see parents as ants and not helicopters.  Practical strategies to work effectively with parents.
jobs.location: May 18/19 Brisbane,  May25/26 Fremantle (WA) June 1/2 Melbourne  June 8/9 Sydney
jobs.description:
Teachers list working with parents as one of their greatest concerns and need for professional learning. Parents are often seen as demanding, helicopters, lawn mowers or absent.  The teacher-parent relationship is often adversarial instead of a partnership.  

This practical workshop will help to alleviate your concerns/fears and provide professional learning in how to work effectively with parents.  Just as there are high impact strategies according to Hattie & Marzano to be used in the classroom, there are also six high impact strategies that parents can use in the home.  

These six strategies are 
1. Authoritative parenting 
2. Teach their children the value of education 
3. Have high aspirations and realistic expectations for them 
4. Family-led learning 
5. Start early and stay engaged in their learning 
6. Home-school communication that values the input of both teachers and parents in respectful relationships.

I work as a Business Development Manager at Buildxact, providing builders and trades with
      simple online business tools. We help our customers with estimating and job management

jobs.description: Buildxact provides builders and trades with simple online business tools. We help our customers get ahead and stay ahead with estimating and job management software to manage the job end-to-end, from first contact and quote to final invoice. Today, Buildxact’s cloud and mobile software is used by construction companies from one or two operators to teams of many, delivering new homes and renovations, as well as small commercial projects. Together they are estimating and project managing hundreds of millions of dollars in profitable construction jobs. Developed in close cooperation with key industry organisations and their members, we learned that customers need business tools that are exceptionally easy to use, locally supported and easy to get started with. Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we have customers spread across Australia, New Zealand and North America.

As Senior Sales Development Consultant at RevenueBuilder, I am responsible for
      sourcing new opportunities and leads for our clients. I am responsible for delivering net
      
      new clients and growing the revenue of client accounts.

Responsible for all business development and account management for Australia's
      
      largest shopping comparison engine.

Between January 2012 - March 2014 I was employed as an Assistant Manager at Jetts Fitness. This role consisted of gym management and personal training. The  management role consisted of sales and marketing, gym inductions, equipment maintenance and other administrative duties. 

As a personal trainer, I developed expertise in attracting and retaining clients, writing fitness programs, goal setting, motivating and educating clients, and tracking their progress using fitness related technology. I am very pleased to have kept the same core group of clients for over 2 years.

I have also assisted the franchisee of Step Into Life, Queens Park with his early morning group training sessions since December 2013.
At Gartner I was responsible for generating revenue from new and existing customers.
In this role I was responsible for generating new business for the company.

This role held responsibility for the acquisition of new direct customers. From lead generation to post-sales service, this role encompassed all parts of the sales cycle including an element of project management. New orders were managed through the provisioning and engineering team to ensure delivery on time and on budget, whilst expectations were managed appropriately throughout.

Charles founded followit Pty Ltd with a number of partners to develop the only platform of its kind in the world, followit.

followit will revolutionise the dynamics of the real estate industry by changing the way the market communicates, connecting buyers and agents in real time.  Launching soon, it will be a real estate experience like no other.  

As a high achieving and respected performer in real estate, Charles is a recognised industry figure throughout Australia.   During his hugely successful career in real estate spanning 25 years, Charles was ranked among the top one per cent of sales people in Australia.  He made his first appearance on this distinguished list when he was just 23. His sales, negotiation and interpersonal skills have earned him numerous accolades throughout the years. 

With his enthusiasm and passion ever present, Charles is best placed to lead the strong team of sales, state and regional managers at followit.

Research shows that organisations with low employee engagement scores experienced 18% lower productivity, 16% lower profitability. (HBR, 2015)

In our rapidly change work environment, organisations who choose to nurture and continually develop their leaders and talent will competitively thrive. Strong research correlates organisations who conduct ongoing employee engagement and culture building programs with increased profitability.

general.headline: Founder and CEO at Tribeca Financial - Passionate about improving the Financial Wellbeing of everyday Australians
general.school: Stanford University Graduate School of Business
general.description:
Ryan has always demonstrated a strong work ethic and a commitment to bettering himself. From taking on a paper round from age 11, to working at McDonalds from age 15 and then onto an assortment of jobs to pay his way through university. This work ethic, coupled with the right education stood him in good stead for when he entered into the financial services workforce – just 7 days after his last university exam.

Ryan’s passion for financial planning came from a desire to assist others in creating wealth for themselves. 
 
Ryan began his financial services career at Mercer, working in their superannuation master trust. He then graduated to an Associate Advisory role at OAMPS, which quickly lead to him becoming a Financial Adviser in his own right. Whilst he found this role rewarding, he knew that he wanted something more, the challenge and rewards of self-employment.

In 2007, Ryan opened his first financial planning firm. This led to three successful business partnerships with business turnover in excess of $2,000,000. However, as Ryan learnt, most business partnerships have an expiry date.

In December 2010 Ryan founded Tribeca Financial. It allowed him the opportunity to implement his learnings and ideas from his previous business relationships. Today, Ryan and the young and dynamic team at Tribeca Financial  maintain a dedicated and constant focus on personal client advice. Ryan has now moved into the full-time role of Managing Director at Tribeca Financial and is enjoying the challenge of mentoring a young and enthusiastic advice team. 

Ryan is extremely passionate about the financial planning industry and bringing young people into it. This is directly reflected in his desire to employ, develop and mentor other financial planning professionals.

The Adviser Board will serve as the voice of the adviser and customer whilst also balancing and advocating for the insurer’s interest.

The Adviser Board will have the opportunity to help shape product design, implementation of strategy, design and implementation of our adviser engagement strategy as well as MLCL’s future service model and industry leadership position.

general.headline: Forbes 30 Under 30 | EY Entrepreneur of the Year National finalist | CEO & Founder of Capital J Investments, Executive Chairman & Co-Fo Fone Dynamics, Co-Fo Alicorn Ventures
general.description:
With an undeniable passion, focus and vision for long term capital growth and a plethora of high profile awards recognising his dynamic business capabilities, this 27-year-old entrepreneur is destined to succeed in any industry he invests in. 

Separating himself by taking bold risks with new technology and embracing an enthusiastic Gen Y attitude towards corporate dealings, Jordan attributes these values to the success and profitability of the businesses he has created over the years.

The former CEO and Managing Director of telecommunications company Fonebox Group - Jordan’s greatest achievement to date - saw the company obtain a prosperous and rewarding exit to Nasdaq-listed J2 Global in October 2016. 

Jordan recently founded and launched Capital J Investments to facilitate, support and mentor future leaders to achieve the same success. 

He is also the Co-Founder of Alicorn Ventures, which focuses on incubating high-growth technology fuelled companies open to wide array of industry verticals. 

Jordan is recognised as a seasoned entrepreneur and as such is finalist and winner of many accolades, including: National Finalist for 2016’s Ernst & Young ‘Entrepreneur of the Year’, Winner of the Brisbane Business News’ 2016 Entrepreneur of the Year and Finalist for Lord Mayor’s Young Business Person of the Year 2015 and 2016 to name a few.

jobs.description:
Capital J Investments is a company to house several private and public investments.
      This investment company has a diverse business portfolio holding varied assets under
      management, with a number of different business streams including wholly owned
      
      businesses and joint ventures all at various stages of development.

Alicorn Ventures is a private accelerator run by two of Queensland’s most awarded entrepreneurs: Dominic Holland and Jordan Grives. Alicorn Ventures typically engages market-leading organisations as co-founders who have identified a critical problem within their organisation or their respective industry, and/or long-term business models. 

Alicorn Ventures provides a high-growth accelerator designed to build, launch and grow companies that utilise technology at their core and to enable and provide a solution to these issues, often launching with our industry co-founders as the anchor customer.

The first of the Alicorn Ventures portfolio companies is Tap Tins, an offering built to address the dwindling collection of charitable cash donations to not-for-profits.

Tap Tins is an initiative to assist in funding charities via an electronic point of sale
      device that sits perfectly on any counter top, processing automated donations within a
      highly reliable platform. It is fund raising technology that is accessible and easier to
      
      contribute to.

Fone Dynamics designs, develops and offers state-of-the-art marketing attribution and communications technologies.  Our call tracking, voice and SMS products allow marketers to combine data and analytics to drive competitive decision-making across the globe, in an accessible and easy-to-use interface.
 
We focus on industry standards, high availability, service and security, which makes Fone Dynamics the number one choice for large enterprise and SMEs.

Jordan Grives was the former Managing Director & CEO of the multi-award winning telecommunications company Fonebox Group. 

Fonebox is Australia’s leading provider of corporate inbound services, specialising in inbound numbers, call routing and 24/7 live operator services, customised inbound solutions and an end-to-end reporting platform solution. 

BRW, Smart Company, Start Up Smart, Anthill Magazine and the Australian Institute of Management have recognised Fonebox nationally for its success.

In October 2016 Jordan had a successful exit to Nasdaq listed J2 Global.

Following a career in the Royal Air Force and then corporate HR specialising in OD and behavioural change, I moved into consultancy.
