Working with the Helping Hand Group (HHG) is a very simple and effective exercise. Combined with an experienced team and amazing auction items, HHG can manage the entire auction component of your next fundraising event. Best of all, this is a free service! HHG's items are provided risk-free: if they don’t sell, they are simply returned at no cost.

HHG has 20 years continual involvement with leading charitable and fundraising events. Knowing that the auction is being handled by experts, allows the organiser to concentrate on the many other aspects of the event. 

The rare and impressive auction items are chosen in joint consultation. Personalised Ballot Bidding® forms, electronic Silent Auction technology (provided at NO COST) and wireless credit card terminals can also be organised for your event. jobs.jobTitle: Vice President - Pacific Region and Managing Director - Australia and New Zealand
jobs.description:
I am delighted to be leading Infor as a Tier 1 IT vendor and the world's 3rd largest Enterprise software company to deliver a regional Transformation strategy with our amazing staff & for our clients in the Pacific Region.  With a recent private equity investment of $2 Billion for an update please review http://www.information-age.com/infor-eyes-oracle-sap-following-2bn-injection-koch-industries-123463235/ and http://www.information-age.com/5-50-sales-3-years-how-infor-got-cloud-right-123461773/

MEDIA RELEASE 16/11/16: Enterprise software firm Infor announced today it has received a $2 billion investment by Koch Equity Development (KED) in a deal that values the company at over $10 billion.  The capital injection will provide Infor access to additional growth funds to expand distribution & accelerate innovation in the enterprise applications space.

KED is the investment & acquisition subsidiary of Koch Industries, which boasts annual revenues of  $100 billion & is estimated to be the 2nd largest privately-held company in the USA.  KED’s president Matt Flamini added “The support we are providing to Infor marks one of the largest investments KED has ever made & demonstrates the confidence we have in Infor’s technology, team & business model.”

Infor has won plaudits for its approach to cloud computing, a transformative industry trend that has rocked the market-leading positions of competitors like Oracle & SAP. Infor was the first company to move mission-critical industry applications to the cloud.  It now counts >66 million users of its cloud apps & 15,000 employees.

Infor's double-digit revenue growth is fueled by a >130% annual increase in SaaS revenue.  Rather than building its own data centre infrastructure, as many of its competitors do, Infor hosts its cloud apps with Amazon Web Services (AWS) (it’s the cloud giant’s largest partner after Netflix).

For announcements of our acquisition of GT Nexus & Birst BI press releases & events go to www.infor.com/news/

The Australian Regenerative Medicine Institute (ARMI) is one of the largest regenerative medicine and stem cell research organisations in the world and it is also the home of the Australian arm of the European Molecular Biology Institute (EMBL).  For more information please visit www.armi.org

As a member of the Leadership Advisory Board (ARMILAB) our role is to enhance the reputation and positioning of the Institute by liaising with key stakeholders including business, government, media and the broader community.  ARMILAB works closely with senior management to promote the vision, role and accomplishments of the Institute. It helps ARMI achieve its goals through:

● Advocacy,
● Contributing experience and insight,
● Supporting and mentoring the Institute’s Director and its leadership, and
● Supporting the Institute’s fundraising objectives by assisting the Institute and Monash Advancement to build key philanthropic, donor and funding relationships.

We welcome your support and for more information please visit our website via http://www.armi.org.au/about/management-boards-and-committees/leadership-advisory-board

jobs.jobTitle: Asia Pacific Japan Vice President & Head of Cloud Services
jobs.description:
SAP is a world leader in IT business applications, cloud services and software manufacture with a market capitalization of $98.4 Billion (FWB:SAP, NYSE:SAP).

Sonya managed the Asia Pacific Japan Region for SAP's Cloud Services Division, now Digital Business Services.  Her key responsibilities were go-to-market strategy, regional sales (bookings & revenue) for the HCM business.  She managed a team of Services Sales Engagement Managers across SAP's 5 APJ market units: Australia-New Zealand, Japan, Greater India, South East Asia,  South Korea and provided assistance to Greater China.  Revenue is achieved with large Business & IT Digital Transformation projects, cloud/SaaS projects & new business development (both direct & via partners).  Sonya managed a high growth business that achieved 220% of target in 2015 & >100% YoY growth in 2016.

Sonya was a key Executive leader working with SAP’s clients to provide shared insights & assurity in planning and executing their key Business & Information Technology (IT) initiatives.  Sonya is passionate about digital strategy, industry trends & her clients Executive responsibilities in providing business initiatives to drive company productivity, cultural improvements & legal frameworks through to practical cost benefits & savings for both public & private sector clients.

Sonya has over 25 years IT industry experience in Australia, SE Asia & the USA.  She currently sits on numerous Industry, Higher Education & Government Advisory Boards & specialises in working with C-suite Executives to provide industry best practice, business directions & technology insights.  She is a Trusted Advisor with specific business skills for large Programs of Work through to specialist engagements & the provision of SAP Subject Matter Expertise.   Sonya is a member of the Project Management Institute (PMI) & holds numerous tertiary qualifications including Masters of Applied Science, Bachelor of Science (Honours) & Bachelor of Applied Science.

Over a twenty year period established a high profile group of companies that were leaders in their fields of financial services, technology, consulting, recruitment and retailing.  The consistent ability to capitalise on opportunities in a diverse range of industries/professions in challenging economic times was crucial to the group’s success.

general.description:
Changing the way organisations attract, build and retain their Human Capital.

The world of human high performance is our home. Our purpose is to create a significant shift in the understanding and practice of high performance in business.

We are made up of a select group of thought leading consultants and coaches that specialise in attracting, building and retaining future-fit leaders. 

Since our launch in 2005, we have helped over 200 clients unlock their most valuable asset: their people with high-performance potential.

the ladder’s completely integrated service offering is designed to serve senior leaders and their teams and includes the following dedicated practices areas: Executive Search, On-Boarding, Leadership Development, Retention, Culture Transformation and Executive Coaching. More information about us can be found at www.the-ladder.com

jobs.description:
Our why – because we believe that high performance is possible for anyone

Our how – through the smart utilisation of technology and connectivity, we are committed to democratising high performance in Australia (and beyond)

Our what – direct to clients; direct to individuals; direct to coaches & facilitators

Our vision – to be recognised as the most efficient and effective providers of high performance solutions for individuals, teams and organisations in Australia by 2020

Our High-Performance Academy (HPA) taps into the deep continuous knowledge of independent specialists – from business, neuroscience and psychology – to open a world of ‘always-on’ experiential learning for you.

Every high-performance strategy is unique. We take three steps to discover yours:

We combine the data-driven expertise of the Academy with our FutureFit methodology to assess your team’s specific learning capacity and agility. With this as our marker, we establish new goals.

We design your programs around real business context – including your vision, mission, culture, challenges and opportunities – to align your employee development plans with big-picture growth.

We unlock the individual potential in your organisation while shaping and driving the larger behavioural shift you want.

In short, equipped with the expertise of our High-Performance Academy, we build your capability for 'future fit' leadership – a capability that embraces disruption, diversity, change and innovation as standard.

general.headline: CEO of The Focus Learning Group / a Multi-Award Winning Training Company / Telstra Business Women's Awards Finalist
general.description:
I am the Founder and CEO of The Focus Learning Group, an award-winning education and learning provider.  We operate 3 major brands in Australia and are rapidly expanding to own the entire learning eco-system! 
Through MCI Solutions, we consult with global brands on people, culture,  training and business performance needs. We have won many awards for using the innovative LEGO® Serious Play™ methodology. Through MCI Digital Learning Solutions, we prepare organisations for the new world of work.  We scour the globe to identify the best digital learning platforms and training options.  
MCI Institute opens doors of opportunity for students so that they can participate in our future via holding nationally recognised qualifications.
Chambers School of Business and School of English provide global students with flexible pathways to achieve their learning goals, including pathways to University.
I have been honoured with the title of Learning and Development Professional of the year 2015 by the AITD.  This award was in recognition of my dedication and commitment to the learning and development community and profession.
I have ensured that MCI was at position #7 on the BRW list of Australia's most innovative companies.  
I have been involved in the corporate training industry for over 27 years and have served in a range of consulting capacities.  I hold a Masters Degree and a PhD in English and have been appointed an honorary member of City and Guilds, the largest examining body in the UK, in recognition of my significant involvement in and contribution to vocational training and education. 
I have also been a Director of an education company listed on the South African Stock Exchange. 
I am invited to speak at several major conferences annually on a variety of topics including vocational training, innovation and leadership.  I am a passionate promoter of women in leadership and in 2015, I was a finalist in the League of Extraordinary Women's entrepreneurship awards.

jobs.description: The Focus Learning Group opens doors of opportunity to students via our 3 major brands:  MCI Institute; MCI Corporate Learning Solutions and Chambers School of Business and School of English.  As an award-winning expert in learning and education in Australia, we are rapidly expanding to cover the full learning eco-system.   We understand the learning requirements of our corporate clients as we shift them in to the new world of learning.  We prepare our Institute students to complete their studies on-line through social and simulated learning experiences.  Our international students, both on-shore in Australia and those seeking a better future for themselves in-country have access through our CRICOS licence to world-class vocational qualifications as well as pathways to a range of Higher Education degrees.

I started the company 14 years ago and have grown it into a multi-million dollar consultancy business, employing 60 full-time and part-time team members and providing training to many top 100 companies in Australia, Our company has been awarded several awards over the past few years including the AHRI 2012 HR Provider of the Year. We also appeared on several BRW lists of Australia's most innovative companies.

I founded Corporate College International in South Africa and built it into the largest
      consultancy in the area of vocational training and development.  I sold the business to
      
      Advtech, an educational company listed on the South African Stock Exchange.

jobs.description:
Change and disruption!  We live in times when you have to be constantly thinking about what's next, what's new and how do I adapt?

We live in the age where information moves fast. The workforce is changing.  It’s more digital, more global, diverse, automation-savvy and social media-proficient.  At the same time, business expectations, needs and demands are evolving faster than ever before.

While some view this as a challenge,  it’s an opportunity.  An opportunity to reimagine HR, talent, and organisational practices.  An opportunity to create platforms, processes, and tools that will continue to evolve and sustain their value over time.

To thrive you must organise around information flows.  And when it comes to L&D and learning functions this means to keep up with information flows, you have to ditch hierarchy and embrace truly democratising learning technologies that put tools and knowledge right into the flow of work.

There's no room for bureaucracy. For successful teams it's about openness, candor, feedback and transparency. If you organise your organisation around these tenets, you’ll thrive. 

This is where 70:20:10 Forum lives.

Reach out to me and explore the why, what and how of the 70:20:10 revolution. Or ask me about our corporate program or my exclusive high performance coaching group where I guide you through the challenges and minefields of 70:20:10.

      Distributor.
